message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.CC 

This paper deals with the computational complexity of differential privacy, which is a topic in cryptography and data privacy. The paper specifically focuses on the hardness of accurately answering statistical queries under differential privacy. This involves concepts from cryptography (such as traitor-tracing schemes) and theoretical computer science (such as computational complexity theory). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). However, the paper also involves concepts from data structures (such as the size of the data universe) and information theory (such as the accuracy of answering queries), which could place it in the sub-categories cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.IT (Information Theory), respectively. Additionally, the paper involves proving hardness results, which is a topic in computational complexity theory, placing it in the sub-category cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Finally, the paper involves analyzing the efficiency of differentially private algorithms, which could place it in the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning).
